properties: Sayuri does a horizontal chop. An excellent 5A with above average horizontal reach and great frame data. The go-to normal for anti airs after RGing a jump in, as the 4F startup allows the move to beat even 5F jAAA strings if timed well. Can be used in pressure strings to threaten command throw super, works especially well if you cover the first half circle of the super during the animation of 5A.

Sayuri kicks her leg out at a downward angle, hitting the opponent as a low. Excellent move to catch opponents by surprise at max c5B range. Causes a lot of hitstun and blockstun, allowing for easy hitconfirms.

Sayuri swipes with her magical wand. This move has is very disjointed, most characters will have a tough time competing with it. Be careful of opponents with ways to get under this normal, such as slides. Perfect for harassing at a safe range and smacking people out of the air, especially against opponents stuck in the corner. Has a long cancel window. The higher hitbox whiffs on every crouching character.

Sayuri's magic wand transforms into a piston which kicks twice. Second hit launches. Has slightly longer range than f5B, making it particularly potent to catch opponents sitting just outside of f5B range. Complements the rest of her neutral buttons but can become dangerous for the player if overused, due to the recovery and extended hurtbox. Short cancel windows makes this difficult to hitconfirm from.

variations.notes: Sayuri's magic wand transforms into a piston which kicks twice. Second hit launches. Has slightly longer range than f5B, making it particularly potent to catch opponents sitting just outside of f5B range. Complements the rest of her neutral buttons but can become dangerous for the player if overused, due to the recovery and extended hurtbox. Short cancel windows makes this difficult to hitconfirm from.

Sayuri's magic wand transforms into a piston which kicks twice. Second hit launches. Has slightly longer range than f5B, making it particularly potent to catch opponents sitting just outside of f5B range. Complements the rest of her neutral buttons but can become dangerous for the player if overused, due to the recovery and extended hurtbox. Short cancel windows makes this difficult to hitconfirm from.

properties: Sayuri extends her arm while crouching. Hits low. A core tool for opening up the opponent. Must be Recoil Guarded low, making it a valuable response after RG. Can be used to threaten command throw super if close to the opponent.

Sayuri's wand turns into a sword and she stabs it up and forward. Has almost identical reach to f5B, only with 6 extra active frames and 4 less recovery, at the cost of a more extended hurtbox. As such, it has many of the same uses as f5B, covering slightly different angles. Also has a long cancel window. Be aware that this move will whiff on Nayuki (Asleep) and Ikumi when they are crouching.
Sayuri's wand turns into a mace and she swings it from her feet to above her head. Decent anti-air for opponents too close or too high to use f5B. Active Frames 2-3 Active Frames 4-9
Active Frames 2-3
Active Frames 4-9

framedata.cancel: N SP J AD IC R

properties: Sayuri punches diagonally downwards. A core part of Sayuri's mixups and pressure. Can be risky against opponents with a 4F anti-air height 5A if the opponent is good at RG 5A timing.

Sayuri extends her leg out in a jumping kick. Excellent priority. Her primary tool for dealing with opponents at the same height in the air. Can be used as a crossup tool but spacing, height and timing is tight.

Sayuri's extends her wand diagonally downwards. One of Sayuri's best normals. Her main normal for getting damage from juggle loops. Your go to air normal when the opponent is below you. Incredible priority.

variations.notes: Sayuri's extends her wand diagonally downwards. One of Sayuri's best normals. Her main normal for getting damage from juggle loops. Your go to air normal when the opponent is below you. Incredible priority.

Sayuri's extends her wand diagonally downwards. One of Sayuri's best normals. Her main normal for getting damage from juggle loops. Your go to air normal when the opponent is below you. Incredible priority.

properties: Sayuri throws the opponent back over her shoulder. This can be both a blessing and a curse - she gets IAD j412C/jC mixups off this, but may lose the corner.

Sayuri grabs the opponent by the neck and electrocutes them with magic. The invincibility on this air throw starts one frame too late to cover its active frames, meaning it can trade unlike most other throws. On the bright side, these late invincibility frames will cover Sayuri during the startup of her jC if it whiffs, and the invincibility is actually longer than what is usual for throws. As player 2, trading with this can be beneficial thanks to a bug that stuns the opponent in place in the air for 333.33 frames, allowing her to easily start a combo. Throw trades act normally as player 1, making the opponent fall straight to the ground without taking any damage.

The invincibility on this air throw starts one frame too late to cover its active frames, meaning it can trade unlike most other throws. On the bright side, these late invincibility frames will cover Sayuri during the startup of her jC if it whiffs, and the invincibility is actually longer than what is usual for throws.

As player 2, trading with this can be beneficial thanks to a bug that stuns the opponent in place in the air for 333.33 frames, allowing her to easily start a combo. Throw trades act normally as player 1, making the opponent fall straight to the ground without taking any damage.
Sayuri shoots a slow moving star projectile.
Ground versions shoot stars at different heights along the ground.
Air versions shoot stars at different angles.
All versions are easily reacted to in neutral but create pressure opportunities.
B version has better recovery but slightly slower startup.
C version fires both A and B projectiles but costs RF meter.

variations.notes: Shoots a slow moving star horizontally close to the ground. Easily reacted to in neutral and leaves you open to IAD punishes, but useful to keep opponents guessing.
Shoots a slow moving star horizontally at eye height. Slightly safer on block than A version (-12 vs -16) with better recovery but slower startup.
Sayuri does the A version and B version in quick succession. Not often used as Sayuri has better places to spend RF meter.
Shoots a slow moving star directly forward while in the air. Can be used to control horizontal space after an air dash.
Shoots a slow moving star angled slightly downward. This projectile does not interact with other projectiles (including Shiori's 5S shield).
Shoots a slow moving star angled more downward than the jB version. Unlike most C specials, this doesn't require RF. Projectile doesn't interact with other projectiles.

properties: Sayuri transforms her wand into a sword and performs different slash patterns.
A version is a quick horizontal slash that moves Sayuri forward.
B version is a vertical up-then-down slash with poor hitbox placement.
C version combines B version into A version with invulnerability and wallbounce properties.
None of these can be canceled into from normal moves.
A version is especially useful when IC'ed after moves like c5B, f5B, and 2B.

variations.notes: Quick horizontal slash that moves Sayuri forward. Excellent move with good range and hitbox. Her most common launcher when coupled with IC.
Vertical up-then-down slash. The first hit won't connect if opponent is standing right next to you. Almost useless with slower startup and easily RGed second hit.
The downward hit after B version's upward slash. Easily reacted to and RGed if the first hit is blocked or whiffs.
First hit of a three-hit sequence (623B + 623A). Has invulnerability on startup. Can be used as a risky reversal option.
Second hit is an overhead that must be blocked high. Part of the C version's three-hit sequence.
Final hit of C version's sequence. Will wallbounce the opponent if they are knocked back to the corner.

properties: Sayuri turns around and holds out her hand for a moment.
If Sayuri is attacked by a physical move, she catches the opponent and throws them behind her.
Sayuri will "remember" the countered attack for her Magical☆Cutter counter.
As this move doesn't rely on a hitbox, it will successfully counter invincible attacks.
From stand RG, this move allows Sayuri to punish 3.66F gaps or longer.
From crouch RG, this move allows Sayuri to punish 5.66F gaps or longer.
Sayuri can only remember one countered move at a time.

variations.notes: Especially useful against jAA pressure. When combined with Magical☆Cutter, gives Sayuri a strong defensive option that opponents must respect.

moves.input: Any attack button during the blockstun
properties: If Sayuri blocks a move previously remembered by "Ah, got your skill~", she flashes white during blockstun.
Pressing any attack button during this flash causes her to perform a rising circular kick.
Sayuri is completely invincible while rising up.
This move cannot be buffered, so inputting during blockstop will not work.
Effectiveness depends on what move was caught - quick attacks with short blockstun are harder to react to.
Player 2 Sayuri has a bug allowing her to perform this during captured move's startup if already in blockstun.

variations.notes: Initial rising kick that starts the Magical☆Cutter sequence. Completely invincible while rising up.
Second hit of the counter sequence. Continues the rising motion with another kick.
Final hit of the counter sequence with slightly larger hitbox and longer active frames.

properties: Sayuri performs a diagonal downward attack with different properties based on button pressed.
A version is a simple downward attack effective after blocked/RGed aerial attacks.
B version causes Sayuri to jump back if blocked/RGed, allowing for immediate follow-up actions.
C version starts with an invulnerable energy ball phase before the attack.
C version automatically turns around to face the opponent when used as a crossup.

variations.notes: Simple downward strike. When used sparingly, can surprise opponents after a blocked or RGed aerial normal, especially jC. Used in max damage combos.
Sayuri jumps back if this move is blocked or RGed. After this jump back, she can immediately use normals and specials (except j412B). Extremely effective when mixed with j412A.
Starts with an energy ball phase with 38 frames of invulnerability. Excellent for predicting wakeup reversals. Has 5 vulnerable frames before the attack hitbox appears.
Second phase has a much larger hitbox than A or B versions. When used as a crossup, automatically turns to face the opponent. Excellent mixup tool with invulnerability frames.

properties: Sayuri dashes forward to slam opponents into the wall.
Air unblockable, making it excellent in blockstrings and mixups.
A version has short range but is relatively safe on block (-4).
B version goes further but is more negative on block (-10).
C version travels the furthest with wallbounce properties and frame 1 invulnerability.

variations.notes: Dashes forward a short distance. Air unblockable and only -4 on block. Incredible in blockstrings when mixed with 236A/B and 623A, creating varied RG timings that make escape difficult.
Travels further than A version but more negative on block (-10). Can be used at ranges where A would whiff, but requires more caution due to the higher punishment risk.
Travels furthest with wallbounce properties on hit. Has frame 1 invulnerability, making it a powerful reversal option. Also useful for punishing certain projectiles from mid-range.

properties: Sayuri summons agent clones that attack the opponent.
A version summons 2 agents and is excellent for Blue IC drain.
B version summons 4 agents and can punish unsafe moves from full screen.
C version summons 6 agents with faster startup for improved long-range punishes.

variations.notes: Sayuri's portion of the attack. Will combo from 5C against most characters. Excellent tool for Blue IC drain.
The 2 agents' portion of the attack, dealing 140 damage per hit for 6 potential hits. Great combo extender.
Sayuri is assisted by 4 agents. Can be used to punish unsafe moves from full screen. Higher overall damage than A version.
Sayuri is assisted by 6 agents. Much faster startup (10f) than other versions, making it even better for long-range punishes. Highest damage potential.

properties: Sayuri dashes forward to slam opponents between walls.
All versions have some invulnerability from frame 1.
A version slams the opponent into one wall, then back into the opposite wall.
B version goes back and forth between walls three times.
C version has the most extended invulnerability frames and greatest damage.

variations.notes: An extra-powerful version of Magical☆Press. This is Sayuri's highest damage combo ender.

Same as A except slams the opponent into one wall, then back into the opposite wall. A brief period of invulnerability from frame 1, extending slightly into startup, makes this a decent reversal option if you react to the startup or whiff of an opponent's move during her usual IC points in pressure, or after 236* FIC, but often only if you can reach the opponent during the invulnerability window..

Same as above, except goes back and forth between the walls 3 times. Same startup as B version, but the invulnerability extends significantly further into active frames, making this less risky to use from further away.

properties: Sayuri grabs the opponent by the neck and electrocutes them.
A version is jumpable after the super flash and rarely used.
B version is impossible to avoid after super flash with frame 1 invulnerability.
C version is impossible to jump after super flash with highest damage.
Even if the throw is avoided, lightning still activates for additional pressure.
Can be buffered during normals to hide the input (e.g. 5AA 63214[6]3214B).

variations.notes: Sayuri grabs the opponent by the neck and electrocutes them. This version is jumpable after the super flash, making it rarely used compared to other versions.
Impossible to avoid after super flash. A crucial part of Sayuri's gameplan, forcing opponents to respect her pressure instead of simply blocking or reacting to overheads.
Impossible to jump after super flash. Same applications as B version but with higher damage at lower cost efficiency.

properties: Sayuri teleports above the opponent and falls on top of them.
An invincible throw that can hit both grounded and aerial opponents.
Can be avoided with some well-timed jumping throw invincibility.
Input requires at least 1 frame of no inputs between 2 and 2A, and between 2A and 5S.
Only available when Sayuri is in Final Memory state (below 1/3 health).
